edu.uchsc.ccp.dmap
Class ASTConverter

java.lang.Object
  edu.uchsc.ccp.dmap.ASTConverter

public class ASTConverter
extends java.lang.Object

Processor for DMAP recognition patterns.

This class uses an AST parser created with JJTree to generate an AST tree structure for each text pattern. It then converts that tree into a DMAP pattern structure that can be used in predictions.

Author:
Will Fitzgerald, R. James Firby

Method Detail

readPatternsFromString

public static java.util.ArrayList<Pattern> readPatternsFromString(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.KnowledgeBase kb,
                                                                  java.lang.String ruleString,
                                                                  boolean retainCase,
                                                                  ProtegeProjectGroup group)
                                                           throws ParseException
Read recognition patterns for concepts in the knowledge base from a string and return them as DMAP patterns.

Parameters:
kb - The Protege Knowledge Base holding the concepts named by the patterns
ruleString - The string containing the named rules
retainCase - True if the pattern should match case, False if case should be ignored.
group - The Protege project group these patterns will reference
Returns:
The patterns
Throws:
ParseException - Means that a pattern doesn't parse

readPatternFromString

public static Pattern readPatternFromString(java.lang.String patternString,
                                            edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.KnowledgeBase kb,
                                            java.lang.String targetFrame,
                                            boolean retainCase,
                                            ProtegeProjectGroup group)
                                     throws ParseException
Read a single pattern from a string and return a DMAP Pattern.

Parameters:
patternString - The string holding the pattern
kb - A Protege Knowledge base
targetFrame - The name of the Protege frame this pattern is for
retainCase - True if the pattern should match case, False if case should be ignored.
group - The Protege project group this pattern will reference
Returns:
The object encoding this pattern for DMAP
Throws:
ParseException - If there is a syntax error in the pattern string

printPatternsFromString

public static void printPatternsFromString(java.lang.String ruleString,
                                           boolean retainCase)
                                    throws ParseException
Print out the syntactic parse tree for a pattern rule string. For debugging purposes only.

Parameters:
ruleString - The string holdsing the pattern rules.
retainCase - True if the pattern should match case, False if case should be ignored.
Throws:
ParseException
